Urgent neuroimaging is required to confirm the diagnosis of stroke and exclude haemorrhage or space-occupying lesions. Angiography is critical to identify vertebral artery dissection or occlusion. A swallow assessment is mandatory due to palatal and glossal palsies. Cardiac and metabolic workup is needed to identify the stroke aetiology.
